DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response to a question that asks whether any new polyps greater or equal to two millimeter were identified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to a newly identified rectal polyp.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk.  Polyps can be neoplastic or non-neoplastic.  Neoplastic polyps usually represent proliferations of the epithelium, and are commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract.  Polyps of the gastrointestinal tract are often called adenomas, are associated with dysplasia, and may eventually transform into carcinomas.  Non-neoplastic polyps may be inflammatory, degenerative, or the result of malformations. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A usually exophytic mass attached to the underlying tissue by a broad base or a thin stalk.  Polyps can be neoplastic or non-neoplastic.  Neoplastic polyps usually represent proliferations of the epithelium, and are commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract.  Polyps of the gastrointestinal tract are often called adenomas, are associated with dysplasia, and may eventually transform into carcinomas.  Non-neoplastic polyps may be inflammatory, degenerative, or the result of malformations.

Property.preferredDefinition: Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: The procedure of having an identity established.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A choice of Yes and No answer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A Conceptual Domain to capture value meanings specfic to SPOREs not suitable for placement elsewhere.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Changed name to match Context per Hvroje Med.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
